questions.qus: #num# In which of these lunar phases does a solar eclipse take place?

reasons.rea: Know more: When the Moon comes in between the Earth and the Sun, it blocks the view of the Sun and casts its shadow on the Earth. This is a solar eclipse. A solar eclipse occurs only on a new moon day.

questions.qus: #num# What type of eclipse is this?

reasons.rea: Know more: Annular solar eclipse occurs when the Moon is on the far side of its orbit with respect to the Earth. At that point, the Moon appears smaller than the Sun and cannot completely cover it. A ring of bright sunlight around the Moon is called annulus.

questions.qus: #num# How many solar eclipses can generally occur in the same calendar month?

reasons.rea: Know more: Generally only one solar eclipse occurs in a calendar month. Two solar eclipses can occur in a calendar month that has two new moons. An historic example of this was the year 1150 AD, wherein a partial solar eclipse was seen on March 1st and another was seen again on March 30th.

questions.qus: #num# What do we see when the Moon is totally in the penumbral shadow of the Earth?

options.option: Dull red disc of the Moon

reasons.rea: Know more: When the Moon is completely in the umbra, it is visible to us as a dull red disc. This happens as some scattered light from the Earth's atmosphere reaches the Moon. When the Moon is partly in the penumbra and partly in the umbra, we see a partial eclipse. Diamond ring is a stage in a total solar eclipse.

questions.qus: #num# How long does a total solar eclipse last?

rea.alignL:
Know more:
During a solar eclipse, if the Moon is on the near side of its orbit with respect to the Earth, it appears big and covers the Sun completely. This results in a total solar eclipse. Only the part of the Earth that lies in the umbral region experiences a total solar eclipse.

questions.qus: #num# Which of these creates a halo around the Moon during an annular solar eclipse?

rea.alignL:
Know more:
The corona is the outermost layer of the Sun's atmosphere, which cannot be seen on a normal day. During an annular solar eclipse, it creates a beautiful halo around the Moon.

questions.qus: #num# Which of these is a luminous object?

reasons.rea: Know more: An object that has light of its own is called a luminous object. The Sun, being a star has light of its own. Whereas, planets and moons in the solar system do not have light of their own. They are visible to us as they reflect sunlight.

questions.qus: #num# Observe the visual of a solar eclipse. Identify the part marked.

reasons.rea: Know more: During a solar eclipse, the Moon's shadow on the Earth has two parts. The faint outer shadow is called penumbra and the dark inner shadow is called umbra. Only the part of the Earth that lies in the umbral region experiences a total solar eclipse.

questions.qus: #num# The total solar eclipse of 2009 occurred in the month of:

reasons.rea: Know more: The solar eclipse of 2009, which occurred on July 22nd, was the longest total solar eclipse of the 21st century. It lasted a maximum of six minutes and 39 seconds off the coast of southeast Asia, causing tourist influx in eastern China, Japan, India and Nepal.

questions.qus: #num# Which of these images shows Baily's beads?

rea.alignL: Know more: Baily's beads are seen just before and after totality. They are the beads-like bursts of light that appear as the Sun's light breaks through the deep valleys of the Moon. It derives its name from Francis Baily, the English astronomer, who first drew attention to them.

questions.qus: #num# The given visual is a stage in a total solar eclipse. What is it called?

reasons.rea: Know more: A few seconds after totality, the Moon moves away and a single large burst of light appears, resulting in a most spectacular sight called "The Diamond Ring". The diamond ring can also be seen a few seconds before totality.

questions.qus: #num# In which of these phases of the Moon does a lunar eclipse occur?

reasons.rea: Know more: When the Earth comes in between the Sun and the Moon, it obstructs the path of light from the Sun and casts its shadow on the Moon. This is a lunar eclipse. A lunar eclipse occurs only on a full moon day.
